abstractText: This method describes how tocollect voucher specimens foraquatic vertebrate species.Thismethod can be used in together withID 1390 BackpackElectrofisherFish CollectionID 115Electrofishing- DetermineElectrofishersettingID 1551 Measuring Fish Length: Total LengthID 3824 Count of Aquatic Vertebrate SpeciesID 3835 Collection of Voucher specimensTogether theres methods method describes how to use a backpackelectrofisherto detect the presence and relativeabundance of aquatic vertebrate species at each site. It applies to waded streams. This method requires measurement of the associatedphysical and chemical environmental variables described in other methods within this protocol.Three persons perform this activity: anelectrofisheroperator, a dip netter, and third person whomonitors and processes the animals collected. The netter should always be limited to 1 personfor consistency. Field supervisors and crew members must be trained prior toelectrofishing. For fishing inwaters containing listed salmon or steelhead, the federal government (NOAA, 2000) hasspecialrequirements for field supervisors and crew members.
title: Collection of Voucher Specimens for Aquatic Vertebrate Species v1.0
